spanishExample: El hombre grande no está muerto, está vivo.
englishTranslation: The big man is not dead, he is alive.

spanishExample: Él quería que lo quisiéramos.
englishTranslation: He wanted us to love him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
quisiéramos: "wanted", "we wanted" (Querer, past subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Era cierto que quería que la fiesta fuera más viva.
englishTranslation: It was certain that he wanted the party to be more lively.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
cierto: "certain", used with Ser to express certainty (adjective)
vivo: "lively" for events/objects (adjective typically used with Ser)

spanishExample: Es cierto que lo quisieron hacer.
englishTranslation: It’s certain that they meant to do it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
cierto: "certain", used with Ser to express certainty (adjective)

spanishExample: Esa chica no está muerta y es única.
englishTranslation: That girl is not dead and is unique.

spanishExample: Espero que no lo quieras.
englishTranslation: I hope you don’t want it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
espero:  hope/wait/expect, I  hope/wait/expect  (Esperar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Este *show* es menos vivo.
englishTranslation: This show(m) is less lively.
vocabIncluded: vivo: "lively" for events/objects (adjective typically used with Ser)

spanishExample: *I hope* que quiera una gran fiesta.
englishTranslation: I hope he wants a great party.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
gran: "big"/"grand" when used right before a noun (adjective)

spanishExample: Lo harían si quisieran una gran fiesta.
englishTranslation: They would do it if they wanted a great party.
vocabIncluded: gran: "big"/"grand" when used right before a noun (adjective)
quisieran: "wanted", "they wanted" (Querer, past subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Lo van a querer cuando yo lo quiera.
englishTranslation: They are going to want it when I want it.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: No queríamos hacer eso.
englishTranslation: We didn’t want to do that.

spanishExample: No quieren hacer lo que él quiso hacer.
englishTranslation: They don’t want to do what he meant to do.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases

spanishExample: Queremos lo que siempre hemos querido.
englishTranslation: We want what we have always wanted.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Querían que él estuviera vivo.
englishTranslation: They wanted him to be alive.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Querías que fuera menos grande.
englishTranslation: You wanted it to be less big.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quiero un nuevo *phone.*
englishTranslation: I want a new phone(m).

spanishExample: Quisiera que fueras serio una vez.
englishTranslation: I would like you to be serious(m) for once.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
quisiera: "would want", "I would want" (Querer, conditional, 1st person)

spanishExample: Quisiera una casa única.
englishTranslation: I’d want a unique house.
vocabIncluded: quisiera: "would want", "I would want" (Querer, conditional, 1st person)

spanishExample: Quisimos que el *car* fuera rápido.
englishTranslation: We meant for the car(m) to be fast.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quisiste una casa nueva esa vez, pero yo no la quise.
englishTranslation: You wanted a new house that time, but I didn’t want it.

spanishExample: Si lo quisieras, sería un problema.
englishTranslation: If you wanted it, it would be a problem.
vocabIncluded: sería: "would be", "he/she/it would be" (Ser, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si quisiera ser serio, lo sería.
englishTranslation: If I wanted to be serious(m), I would be.
vocabIncluded: sería: "would be", "I would be" (Ser, conditional, 1st person)
